place.placeName: Jianfu Monastery Small Wild Goose Pagoda
place.p: Little Wild Goose Pagoda [Tang Dynasty Major Historical and Cultural Sites Protected at the National Level] The square 15-storey multi-eaved and hollow brick tower, also known as Jianfusi Pogada, is a representative of the early multi-eaved pagoda. Together with the Giant Wild Goose Pagoda, it is an important symbol preserved from Chang 'an City of Tang Dynasty. The Small Wild Goose Pagoda was built during the Tang dynasty under Emperor Zhongzong of Tang (r 705–710). The earthquakes in 1487 and 1556 shook the pagoda and damaged it so that it now stands at a height of 43.94 m with thirteen storeys and a base length of 11.38m. The base of the pagoda is made from square Sanskrit bricks, measuring 23.38 m long and 3.2 m high. The tower is hollow with a single wall. The ground storey has the greatest height and the sideline length of every storey decrease progressively. Like a rectangular pyramid, the higher the storey is, the smaller the space becomes. Its overall outline is a naturally relaxed shuttle curve, with eaves between every two storeys and two rows of water chestnut-shaped stones. The ground storey has two doors facing south and north respectively and other storeys have exquisite windows. The bluestone bolt and doorframe on the ground storey are carved with patterns of God taking care of the virtuous man and Coriandrum sativum. Exquisite windows on the 5th to 11th storey are decorated with two square towers on each side. Inside the pagoda, a narrow wooden stairway, as well as a brick stairway, winds its way to the top, with several inscriptions of Tang to Qing Dynasty on the wall. According to the line carving stone in 1449, the original tower top was made up of a round base, two-tier middle and top decorated with a pearl. In 1964~1965, the pagoda underwent extensive repairs and the tower base was discovered. During the repair, the part over fourteen storeys remained unchanged like that in the past 500 years. (Reference: Famous and Ancient Temple in Xi’an )

The "morning bell" of the Small Wild Goose Pagoda is an iron bell of the Jin Dynasty washed away by the Weihe River in the worshiping buddhist temple in wugong village. it brings convenience to the production and life of the citizens of Xi'an City, because the monks of Jianfu Temple ring the clock every day. The Bell forms the well-known "morning bell of the wild goose pagoda" scenery in Guanzhong area. At present, this record was first seen in the collection of liuxipo by Liu Chuxiu of the Ming Dynasty. During the Ming and Qing dynasties, the military examination graduates in Shaanxi and Gansu followed the example of the Tang people and named the little wild goose pagoda, which further enriched the connotation of the little wild goose pagoda as a local scenic spot. There is existing 18 famous steles of imperial examination on military in the provincial level, which is an important material for studying the military imperial examination of the Ming and Qing dynasties. On the lintel of the stone north gate of the little wild goose pagoda, there is the miracle of the separation and combination of the little wild goose pagoda due to the earthquake recorded by Wang He in the year of Jiajing of the Ming Dynasty (1551), which increases the preference to this pagoda from local people. There are also more than 20 inscriptions of Jianfu Temple repaired in the courtyard of Small Wild Goose Pagoda from the Song dynasty to the Ming and Qing dynasties, which is the direct material evidence of the ancient people's protection of historical relics and local scenic spots.

desc.p: 小雁塔［唐代·全国重点文物保护单位］方形十五级密檐式空心砖塔。又名荐福寺塔，是早期密橹式塔的代表作，与大雁塔同为唐长安城保留至今的重要标志。始建于唐景龙年间，明成化二十三年Cl 487) 和嘉靖三十四年十二月(l556) 地震使塔顶坠毁，塔身中裂。现残存十三级，残高43.94 米，底层边长11. 38 米＾塔座为梵砖方台，底边长23.38 米，高3. 2 米。塔身单壁中空、底层较高，二层以上高度逐层递减．愈上愈促．整体轮廓呈自然缓和的梭形曲线。层间叠涩出檐，砌两排菱角牙子。底层南北辟券门、以上各层南北均开券窗：底层青石门梢、门框上线刻天人供养图案及荽草纹饰、第五至第十一层南券窗两侧饰有方形小塔各一。塔内设木构楼层及砖砌登道，塔壁有唐至清代题刻多处。据明正统十四年（1449）荐寺殿堂线刻石．原塔刹当由圆形刹座、两层相轮和宝珠刹尖组成。1964~1965 年修整加固并发掘了塔基；维修时，保持了五百年来无十四层以上的现状（参见《西安的名刹古寺门》）

小雁塔的“晨钟”系武功崇教寺被渭河冲走的金代铁钟，因荐福寺僧人每日敲此钟报时，给西安城的市民生产、生活带来便利，遂形成关中地区所熟知的“雁塔晨钟”一景。目前，这一记载最早见于明人刘储秀的《刘西陂集》。明清时期，陕甘两地的武举人效法唐人，题名小雁塔，更加丰富了小雁塔作为地方名胜的内涵。塔下现存武举乡试题名碑18 通 \是研究明清武举考试的重要资料。小雁塔石质北门楣上，留有明嘉靖辛亥年( 1551) 王鹤所记小雁塔因地震分而又合的奇事，更是增添了当地民众对此古迹的喜爱。小雁塔院内还存有20 余通自宋至明清历朝对荐福寺修缮的碑刻，是古人对历史遗物和地方名胜进行保护的直接物证。
